directoryScan
Class FileOnDisk

java.lang.Object
  directoryScan.FileOnDisk
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Comparable<FileOnDisk>
public class FileOnDisk
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<FileOnDisk>

Class FileOnDisk is used as an object for files that are picked up by the exploreDir in the DirectorySize Class; It contains setters and getters for String file and double size, a toString method which formats the file string properly, and a compareTo method which is used for ordering the list

Version:
1.0 - CSCI-102 Project 2 - 3/30/14
Author:
Devin Visslailli

 int compareTo(FileOnDisk file)
          Compare to method which overrides standard compare to; Checks for file size and determines in a list which file is larger; Also if the sizes are equal, it checks alphabetical order

compareTo

public int compareTo(FileOnDisk file)
Compare to method which overrides standard compare to; Checks for file size and determines in a list which file is larger; Also if the sizes are equal, it checks alphabetical order
